User Interface¶

Generating UI¶

Generating the UI is handled by the generate_ui module.

The UI is sorted into several tabs. Each tab groups multiple SPN’s together, usually by similar type. (DIG I/P, PWM O/P, VOLTAGE…)

Each Tab contains a number of labels, buttons, dropdown menus, and text boxes.

This module contains functions that handle the creation of widgets, and their placement within the UI.

class UserInterface.generate_ui.generate_ui(ob1, ob2)¶

This module is responsible for initializing each component of the UI, as well as it’s grid placement.

generate_actuator_ui()¶

Generates Widgets under ‘Actuator’ UI Tab.

actuator_dict={1:”act1”,2:”act2”,3:”act3”} #Dictionary with Actuator # : Actuator Name pair actuator_label=[] actuator_load=[] actuator_pos=[] actuator_set=[] actuator_btn=[]

generate_open_ui()¶

Function for generating components in the ‘Open’ UI tab

Will Show Configured SPN’s with a drop down menu to select open configuration.

Searches for ‘Open_to’ value in column D of config_sheet.xlsx

Value should either be B(open to battery), G(open to ground) or Both(where we can select between B or G in the UI, not open to both at the same time)

generate_spn_ui()¶

The function generate_spn_ui is responsible for creating these UI tabs and their widgets:

DIG I/P | DIG O/P | VOLTAGE | PWM I/P | PWM O/P | Freq | Pulse

get_sim_mode()¶

When called, will read save state of Simulator Mode, and will disable/enable all widgets depending on value.

Value is stored in SimMode.txt (0 or 1)

Updating UI¶

Once the UI is generated and the components initialized, a thread handles any updates and changes made to the widgets listed.

class UserInterface.update_ui.update_ui(ob1, ob2)¶
mainloop()¶

Holds Tkinter .mainloop()

Main function for running UI.

DO NOT REMOVE

update_cpu()¶

Displays CPU usage under Settings tab

Uses ‘psutil’

update_settings()¶

Updates Color Of Settings Buttons depending on their linked value.

update_ui_offline()¶

Part of ui_update thread.

Checks to see if any boards are offline. If so, linked UI widgets will be disabled.

update_ui_spn()¶

Function to update UI based on dictionary data.

Tied to First 7 SPN Tabs.

This is what causes the buttons to flash red and green in testing mode.

UI Callbacks¶

These functions are meant to be callbacks that are ran when the corresponding widget is activated.

class UserInterface.ui_callbacks.ui_callbacks(ob1, ob2)¶
buttonDig(i)¶

Callback for buttons contained within Digital I/P tab

On click, will toggle state of linked Relay.

Parameters

i (int) – Index of corresponding SPN

dig_ip_callback(selection)¶

Updates Value of Digital Inputs and saves in Dictionary.

‘dig_ip_mode’ dictionary updated with SPN : State

Parameters

  • i (int) – SPN index

  • selection (String) – ‘Normal’ or ‘Open-Circuit’

freqToggle(i)¶

Callback for toggling SPN’s configured as Frequency Input.

Parameters

i (int) – index of SPN to be toggled

open_option_callback(i, selection)¶

Updates values of ‘Open to’ SPNS.

Dictionary open_mode will be updated with specified SPN id and selected value. (open to ground or open to battery)

Parameters

  • i (int) – Index of SPN

  • selection (String) – “Ground” or “Battery”

output_send(spn, selected_val)¶

Callback for dropdown menus (Output Boards)

Will set Relay on Output Board to selected State.

Parameters

  • spn (int) – SPN number

  • selected_val (String) – State to set Relay to:[‘Normal’, ‘Open-Circuit’,’Battery’, ‘Ground’]

pass_to_board(spn_number, data)¶

Passes SPN number and index to terminal to be printed.

{deprecated}

pulseToggle(i)¶

Callback for toggling Relays configured as Pulse Input.

Parameters

i (int) – index of SPN to be toggled.

pwmToggle(i)¶

Callback for toggling Relays configured as PWM input.

Parameters

i (int) – SPN index

reset_CAN()¶

When Button is clicked, this function will run a bash script to reset the CAN network.

The script ‘resetCAN.sh’ sets the CAN bus down and back up.

Baud Rate: 250,000

sim_callback()¶

Function to toggle the UI between simulator mode and normal mode.

Greys out widgets when simulator mode is not active.

Writes state of simMode to text file.

voltToggle(i)¶

Toggles state of Relays configured as Voltage Inputs.

Parameters

i (int) – index of SPN to be toggled
